intro: Annickia atrocyanescens, commonly known as the dark blue mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while it provides some photosynthetic support to its host. Its berries, which are typically dark blue, are an important food source for various bird species. Due to habitat loss, Annickia atrocyanescens is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
